etymology.description: 㫃(㫃) (guó, "flag") + 子(子) (zǐ, "child") = a child holding a flag -> travel
etymology.interpretation: The character depicts the image of a child holding a flag, symbolizing the action of travel or movement, as flags were often used for signaling during journeys.

examples.chinese: 他斿名山大川(他斿名山大川)。
examples.english: He travels through famous mountains and rivers.

examples.chinese: 古代诗人斿江山(古代詩人斿江山)，寻觅灵感(尋覓靈感)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài shīrén yóu jiāngshān, xúnmì línggǎn.
examples.english: Ancient poets travel across rivers and mountains, seeking inspiration.

examples.chinese: 他斿万里路途(他斿萬里路途)，心旷神怡(心曠神怡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yóu wànlǐ lùtú, xīnkuàng shényí.
examples.english: He traverses a thousand-mile journey, feeling relaxed and joyful.
